name: Tropical
description: Tropical climate zones are characterized by high temperatures and significant rainfall throughout the year. They are typically found near the equator and support lush rainforests with high biodiversity.

name: Subtropical
description: Subtropical climate zones are located poleward of the tropics, generally between 23.5° and 40° latitude in both hemispheres. They experience hot summers and mild winters, with varying rainfall patterns.

name: Temperate
description: Temperate climate zones are characterized by distinct seasons, with warm summers and cold winters. They are found in the middle latitudes and support deciduous and coniferous forests.

name: Arid
description: Arid climate zones, or deserts, are characterized by extremely low rainfall and high temperatures. They support specialized plant life adapted to dry conditions.

name: Semi-arid
description: Semi-arid climate zones receive more rainfall than arid regions but less than humid areas. They are often characterized by grasslands and shrublands, supporting drought-resistant trees.

name: Boreal
description: Boreal climate zones, or subarctic climates, are characterized by long, cold winters and short, cool summers. They are found in high latitudes and support coniferous forests (taiga).
